meanings.definition: The light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The retina captures light in the eye.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her retina during the eye check-up.
meanings.sent3: The retina decided to take a break from all the light it was capturing.
meanings.sent4: Her retina was like a camera, capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The retina, like a delicate film, played a crucial role in vision.

meanings.definition: A network of nerve cells and fibers in the eye.
meanings.sent1: The retina sends signals to the brain for processing.
meanings.sent2: The intricate network of the retina helps us see clearly.
meanings.sent3: The retina and the brain had a conversation about the images they saw.
meanings.sent4: Her retina was like a busy city, with nerve cells bustling around.
meanings.sent5: The retina's network was like a well-organized team, ensuring vision worked smoothly.
